function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Underestimation of COVID-19 prevalence due to seasonal temperature changes and wastewater temperatures","Impact":"Misleading assessment of the epidemic and potential for uncontrolled spread","Mitigation":"Incorporating seasonal temperature and wastewater temperature data, adjusting health metrics accordingly","Technologies":"Wastewater-based epidemiology (WBE), temperature monitoring sensors, data analysis tools","People":"Public health authorities, epidemiologists, policy makers","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions"},{"Description":"Misinterpretation of stable case load due to temperature changes not being accounted for","Impact":"Failure to recognize a significant increase in infected individuals, leading to false sense of control over the epidemic","Mitigation":"Integration of temperature-adjusted model predictions, continuous monitoring of virus counts","Technologies":"Modeling software, temperature monitoring sensors, data analytics platforms","People":"Epidemiologists, researchers, public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Changing population focus for wastewater-based epidemiology (WBE) observations due to seasonal temperature changes","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of virus prevalence at different times of the year, leading to misinformed public health decisions","Mitigation":"Seasonal adjustment of WBE monitoring strategies, continuous adaptation of sampling locations","Technologies":"Wastewater sampling tools, temperature monitoring sensors, data visualization software","People":"Wastewater treatment specialists, public health officials, environmental researchers","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions"}]}
